metadata.title: CVE-2015-8877 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
The gdImageScaleTwoPass function in gd_interpolation.c in the GD GraphicsLibrary (aka libgd) before 2.2.0, as used in PHP before 5.6.12, usesinconsistent allocate and free approaches, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption) via a crafted call, asdemonstrated by a call to the PHP imagescale function.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8877` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgd-tools - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
libgd3 - 2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgd2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.1.1-4ubuntu0.16.04.1').
